1.brief: properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:
to be (causatively, make) lofty, especially inaccessible; by implication, safe, strong; used literally and figuratively
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

2.brief: to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem

3.brief: properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a donation; euphemistically, tribute; specifically a sacrificial offering (usually bloodless and voluntary)
a step or (collectively, stairs, as ascending); usually a holocaust (as going up in smoke)
to be fat; transitively, to fatten (or regard as fat); specifically to anoint; figuratively, to satisfy;  to remove (fat) ashes (of sacrifices)

4.brief: to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
the heart (as the most interior organ);
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
advice; by implication, plan; also prudence
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)

5.brief: properly, to creak (or emit a stridulous sound), i.e. to shout (usually for joy)
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to flaunt, i.e. raise a flag; figuratively, to be conspicuous
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

6.brief: at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
anointed; usually a consecrated person (as a king, priest, or saint); specifically, the Messiah
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity
force (literally or figuratively); by implication, valor, victory
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south

7.brief: a vehicle; by implication, a team; by extension, cavalry; by analogy a rider, i.e. the upper millstone
a horse (as leaping); also a swallow (from its rapid flight)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male

8.brief: to bend the knee; by implication, to sink, to prostrate
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
to duplicate or repeat; by implication, to protest, testify (as by reiteration); intensively, to encompass, restore (as a sort of reduplication)

9.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)

10.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
